meanings.sent1: The towel felt moister after being left out in the rain.
meanings.sent2: The grass was moister in the morning due to the dew.
meanings.sent3: The moister soil made it easier for the plants to grow.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes were moister than usual as she watched the emotional movie.
meanings.sent5: The moister air near the ocean made it feel refreshing on a hot day.

meanings.definition: More wet or damp than something else
meanings.sent1: The cake was moister than the cookies she baked.
meanings.sent2: His clothes were moister than hers after being caught in the rain.
meanings.sent3: The moister sponge absorbed the liquid faster than the dry one.
meanings.sent4: The moister soil yielded a richer harvest than the dry fields.
meanings.sent5: The moister climate in the tropics made her hair frizzy.
